issues.description: The problem statement contains two different orders for the Lecture attributes, and the constructor order in the solution follows the textual list rather than the UML. Line 17 of the problem statement lists the attribute order as (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors), but the UML snippet (lines 63–69) shows a different order (numberOfInscribedStudents, lectureName, numberOfLecturers, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfTutors). The exercise explicitly asks students to make the constructor follow the UML order, so this contradiction can confuse students about the correct constructor parameter order and lead to implementation or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the attribute/constructor order consistent across the problem statement, UML, template and solution. Either (A) update the UML in the problem statement to list the attributes in the same order as the textual list (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors) and document that constructor parameters follow that order, or (B) change the textual attribute list to match the UML order and adjust the solution/template constructor signature accordingly. Also consider explicitly showing the expected constructor signature in the description to avoid ambiguity for students.
